meanings.definition: Inbuilt: Inherent; existing as an essential characteristic.
meanings.sent1: Her intelligence is inbuilt, making her a natural problem solver.
meanings.sent2: The inbuilt curiosity of children drives their desire to explore the world.
meanings.sent3: The inbuilt love for ice cream in our family always leads to dessert battles.
meanings.sent4: His inbuilt sense of direction is like a compass guiding him through unfamiliar streets.
meanings.sent5: The inbuilt instinct to protect her cubs makes the mama bear fiercely defensive.

meanings.definition: Inbuilt: Built-in; incorporated as part of a structure or system.
meanings.sent1: The inbuilt camera on the phone allows you to capture moments instantly.
meanings.sent2: The inbuilt alarm system in the house provides added security.
meanings.sent3: The inbuilt GPS in the car always knows the way, even when we're lost.
meanings.sent4: The inbuilt shelves in the closet make organizing clothes a breeze.
meanings.sent5: The inbuilt microphone in the device ensures clear audio during calls.
